response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (19 years old)", "high", "Young age is associated with higher recidivism risk due to ongoing behavioral development and social influences."],
    ["Race (White)", "medium", "Race is not a strong risk factor by itself, but in some datasets it may be considered neutral or slightly variable."],
    ["Criminal history (3 arrests and conviction)", "high", "A record of multiple arrests and a conviction heightens the likelihood of recidivism."],
    ["Physical profile (6 ft 0 in, 180 lbs)", "low", "Physical attributes such as height and weight have little to no correlation with criminal recidivism."],
    ["Marital and living status (never married, living alone)", "medium", "Lack of familial support through marriage or cohabitation may contribute to instability."],
    ["Education (high school diploma, not in college)", "medium", "Limited educational attainment can correlate with fewer opportunities, impacting recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment history (7 jobs in the past year)", "high", "Frequent job changes indicate employment instability, which is a strong risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Drug use (marijuana and cocaine use in the past four years)", "high", "Substance abuse is a significant predictor of future criminal behavior and recidivism."],
    ["Mental health (periods of feeling severely down)", "medium", "Experiences of depressive symptoms can undermine rehabilitation and social integration."],
    ["Family background (raised with both biological parents in a household of 5)", "low", "A stable family environment in early life tends to lower the risk of recidivism."],
    ["Community environment (urban upbringing)", "medium", "Urban environments expose individuals to higher rates of crime, which can increase recidivism risk."],
    ["Religious belief (disengaged from religious influence)", "medium", "Lack of religious or community affiliation may reduce available social support mechanisms."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 80
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 3 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 180 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 7 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
